stories.text: Parsers VC collects data on startups, investors, and venture capital firms in real time. The databases are updated every 24 hours. It's very simple: Parsers VC installs its trackers on the venture capital funds' websites (namely the startup, team, and news sections) and automatically collects all updates. The data is also obtained from social networks and news sites. Thus, there is no need to wait for the startup or venture capital firm itself to update the information on the aggregator site, all updates appear by themselves. You can see examples of the data here: https://parsers.vc/about/
stories.title: Show HN: Parsers VC – Real-time tracking Venture Capital data provider

stories.text:
What is the best way to discover npm packages?

All of the ways I've found seem very manual and imprecise. Any recommendations or improvements? Here is what I try:

Process: - Google "npm for feature" check search suggest and results - Check https://snyk.io/advisor/ for similar results and quality score of packages - google search "package vs ..." and see what comes up - Check packages used in open source projects

Other suggestions?
stories.title: Ask HN: What is the best way to discover NPM packages?
